```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE)
library(readr)
library(tidyverse)
library(fs)
library(janitor)
library(tidyr)
library(plotly)
download.file(
  url = "https://pollofpolls.eu/get/polls/GB-parliament/format/csv",
  destfile = "uk.csv",
  mode = "wb"
  )

uk <- read_csv(
  "uk.csv",
   col_names = TRUE,
   cols(
    date = col_date(format = ""),
    firm = col_character(),
    n = col_double(),
    sd = col_double(),
    source = col_character(),
    Con = col_double(),
    Green = col_double(),
    Lab = col_double(),
    LibDem = col_double(),
    UKIP = col_double(),
    SNP = col_double()
    )) %>% 
  clean_names()

fs::file_delete("uk.csv")
```

# The interactive plot

```{r plotly}
uk <- uk %>% 
  gather(party, seats, con:snp)

p <- plot_ly(uk, x = ~date, y = ~seats, type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines')
```
